div.p:
I fear that you
will feel yourself
sadly bored by
letters pouring in on
you from all sides,
I have written you
by way of India -
by Sir Thomas
Maclear at the
Cape & now by Dr
Meller who kindly
takes charge of this
on his way to his con-
-sulate in Madagascar
My object is to ask
you to assist me
to get 20 or 25 natives
of Johanna as carriers
on my next trip.
I intended to take
Belooches but Col.Colonel
Rigby dissuades me
from so doing. I
would take Johanna
men entirely and if
you can say trust
to getting them or not
as the case may be
write to me care of
G.M. Stewart Esq
at Messrs Remmington
& Co. Bombay.
I have only £500 from
Foreign Office - £500
from Royal Geo. SocyRoyal Geographical Society
and £1000 from a
private friend. &
am not disposed to
be illiberal within
my means. I propose
£1 per month for
common men
as it is not skilled
labour, and more
such as you would
direct for headmen
and a cook. If
you can manage
this for me and
let me know that
you can before I
leave Bombay I
would ask the
man of war that
takes me over to
come to you. I am
doubtful if I can
bring my steamer
across again. &
will go up Rovuma
in boats. I would
need an engagement
for 20 months or
so. Hoping this
may find you in
good health. I am &c
